Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Oil Lamp made of Black Pottery
Description: An oil lamp made of black pottery; it is a large oil lamp, which gives plenty of light. On the body there are simple geometrical designs that consist of vertical lines and branches beginning at the front and extending to the opening in the center. The lamp has a handle by which it could be carried. The mouth is broken and the body has been restored but still has some cracks.Oil lamps of this type are distinguished by having an opening at the front for the wick, and a further opening at the center through which to pour the oil.
